Articles.Content:
I have had Kerbal Space Program for about a month now, but I've decided to get a move on and join the forum! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Any tips for maneuvering in the atmosphere with mainsails? I spin out almost every time. ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Anyways, hello!

Yes: do not move to quickly, have SAS on (hit "T"), and try placing fixed or dynamic fins near the base of your craft.

Welcome aboard!

Manuevering with mainsails? Whackjob, I found your long-lost brother!

Srsly, I'd try adding fins at the bottom of your rocket, and checking where your CoM and CoL are. Unless it's a plane, in which case all bets are off.

Welcome home!

Bout darn time!

Welcome. =)

To maneuver a large rocket - use larger fins, the idea is to keep the center of lift well behind your CoM for rockets.
